messages.message:
when the screen is short, the app nav icons become super small bc of the scrollbar :lolcry:

i think it’s impossible to have the same padding and icon size when the scrollbar appears, and we also don’t want to hide the scrollbar since there are more nav buttons than can be shown

in the classic platform, we handled this with an ellipsis at the bottom of the dock to show more buttons - what do you think about applying the same pattern here? @Travis
wait i’m not seeing that behavior what :confused_dog:
i think you don’t have scrollbars turned on by default
ah okay yeah when i turn scrollbar to always on I see the issue
and a lot of our customers use microsoft, so they often run into these scrollbar issues, which is why i have them turned on by default
I remember there being lots of math involved for the sidebar... might be nice to standardize it into a pollen component
I wonder if this would be solved by switching to the SideNav (https://pollen.instabase.com/?path=/docs/layout-sidenav--docs) pollen component
I would love to get rid of that left sidebar altogether.
use one universal header across the entire platform, and have pages manage their navigation within the main page body.
as for right now if we wrap those icons in a div then they will stop getting squished, probably the fastest fix.

I’m working with design on overhauling the App Store/App View and that’s where I’ll be pushing for this left sidebar to go away. All of the options currently in it are a little confusing as well as hidden and I’d like to bring those out into more appropriate places.
